snippet: The announcement, by Yukiya Amano, the director of the United Nations nuclear agency, suggested his statement about an agreement two weeks ago may have been premature.
abstract: Top United Nations nuclear official Yukiya Amano announces new talks with Iran aimed at gaining access to restricted sites; Amano also expresses concern about satellite images that showed the Iranians had demolished buildings at one site that inspectors have been eager to visit, suggesting that his previous announcement that Iran had basically agreed to allow access to inspectors may have been premature.

byline.contributor: William J. Broad contributed reporting from New York, and Thomas Erdbrink from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: The announcement, by Yukiya Amano, the director of the United Nations nuclear agency, suggested his statement about an agreement two weeks ago may have been premature.

headline.seo: U.N. Nuclear Monitor Announces New Talks With Iran
headline.main: U.N. Nuclear Chief Announces New Talks With Iran
headline.print_headline: U.N. Nuclear Chief Announces New Talks With Iran Over Access to Sites
